making updates. Learning stops when the algorithm achieves an acceptable level of performance.
Supervised learning problems can be further grouped into regression and classiﬁcation problems.
 Classiﬁcation: A classiﬁcation problem is when the output variable is a category, such
as red and blue or disease and no disease.
 Regression: A regression problem is when the output variable is a real value, such as
dollars or weight. The contrived example above is a regression problem.
